recipes.title: Mediterranean Garden Salad
recipes.desc: Fresh and vibrant salad with tomatoes, cucumbers, lettuce, and paneer dressed in olive oil and herbs.
steps: Wash and chop tomato, cucumber, and lettuce.
Cube the paneer and lightly sauté if desired.
Mix vegetables and paneer in a bowl.
Drizzle olive oil, sprinkle oregano, salt, and black pepper.
Toss well and serve fresh.

ecoImpact.foodWasteSaved: Saved approx. 120g fresh veggies from spoilage
ecoImpact.carbonSaved: Reduced 0.3 kg CO₂ emissions vs packaged salad

recipes.tip: Use leftover cucumber and lettuce in smoothies or wraps to reduce waste.

recipes.title: Grilled Cheese Sandwich
recipes.desc: Classic comfort food with golden bread and gooey cheese filling.
steps: Spread butter on bread slices.
Place cheese and tomato slices between the bread.
Grill on medium heat until golden brown.
Serve hot.

ecoImpact.carbonSaved: Reduced 0.2 kg CO₂ emissions vs takeout

recipes.tip: Toast leftover bread ends for croutons instead of tossing them.

recipes.title: Masala Omelette
recipes.desc: Spicy omelette with onion, tomato, capsicum, and a hint of coriander.
steps: Beat eggs in a bowl with salt and black pepper.
Chop onion, tomato, and capsicum.
Heat olive oil in a pan, sauté vegetables for 2 minutes.
Pour eggs over vegetables and cook until set.
Fold and serve hot.

ecoImpact.carbonSaved: Avoided 0.25 kg CO₂ emissions by cooking at home

recipes.tip: Use leftover chopped veggies from dinner prep to make omelettes.

recipes.title: Vegetable Pulao
recipes.desc: Aromatic rice cooked with peas, carrots, corn, and spices.
steps: Rinse rice and soak for 10 minutes.
Heat olive oil, sauté onion, garlic, and ginger.
Add chopped carrot, peas, and corn.
Add rice and water, season with turmeric and salt.
Cook until rice is done and fluffy.

ecoImpact.carbonSaved: Reduced 0.4 kg CO₂ vs ordering fried rice

recipes.tip: Store leftover pulao in fridge; reheat with splash of water to prevent drying.

recipes.title: Paneer Butter Masala
recipes.desc: Creamy curry with paneer, tomato, butter, and spices.
steps: Heat butter in a pan, sauté onion, garlic, and ginger.
Add tomato puree and spices, cook until oil separates.
Add paneer cubes and simmer for 5 minutes.
Garnish with coriander and serve hot with rice or bread.

ecoImpact.foodWasteSaved: Saved 300g dairy and vegetables at home
ecoImpact.carbonSaved: Reduced 0.5 kg CO₂ vs ordering online

recipes.tip: Use leftover curry as sandwich filling next day.

recipes.title: Vegetable Sandwich
recipes.desc: Healthy sandwich with bread, cucumber, tomato, carrot, and lettuce.
steps: Spread mayonnaise on bread slices.
Layer cucumber, tomato, carrot, and lettuce.
Season with salt and pepper.
Close sandwich and cut diagonally.
Serve fresh.

ecoImpact.carbonSaved: Reduced 0.3 kg CO₂ emissions by home prep

recipes.tip: Wrap sandwiches in cloth instead of plastic foil.

recipes.title: Aloo Gobi
recipes.desc: Dry curry of potato and cauliflower, flavored with spices.
steps: Heat olive oil, sauté onion, garlic, and ginger.
Add potato and cauliflower, cook 10 mins.
Add spices and salt, cook until vegetables are tender.
Garnish with coriander and serve hot.

ecoImpact.carbonSaved: Reduced 0.35 kg CO₂ emissions vs takeout

recipes.tip: Use potato peels to make crispy chips.

recipes.title: Fruit Yogurt Bowl
recipes.desc: Refreshing yogurt bowl topped with banana, apple, and honey.
steps: Slice banana and apple.
Spoon yogurt into a bowl.
Top with banana, apple, and drizzle honey.
Serve chilled.

ecoImpact.carbonSaved: Reduced 0.2 kg CO₂ vs packaged snack

recipes.tip: Freeze overripe bananas to blend into smoothies.

recipes.title: Potato Peel Chips
recipes.desc: Crispy chips made from leftover potato peels.
steps: Wash potato peels thoroughly to remove dirt.
Pat them dry.
Toss peels with olive oil, salt, and black pepper.
Spread on a baking tray and bake at 200°C for 15–20 mins until crispy.
Serve hot.
recipes.tip: Turn potato peels into crunchy snacks instead of discarding.

recipes.title: Grilled Chicken Sandwich
recipes.desc: Juicy grilled chicken with fresh vegetables in a sandwich.
steps: Season chicken with salt and black pepper.
Grill the chicken in olive oil until fully cooked.
Toast the bread slices lightly.
Spread mayonnaise on bread and layer with lettuce, tomato, and grilled chicken.
Serve immediately.

ecoImpact.carbonSaved: Reduced 0.4 kg CO₂ emissions by home-cooking instead of takeout

recipes.tip: Use leftover grilled chicken from dinner to make sandwiches the next day.

recipes.title: Chicken & Vegetable Stir Fry
recipes.desc: Quick stir fry with chicken, capsicum, carrot, and peas in light seasoning.
steps: Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces and season with salt and black pepper.
Heat olive oil in a pan and sauté garlic.
Add chicken and cook until lightly browned.
Add carrot, capsicum, and peas; stir fry 5–7 mins.
Squeeze lemon juice before serving and toss well.

ecoImpact.carbonSaved: Reduced 0.45 kg CO₂ emissions vs takeout meal

recipes.tip: Use leftover vegetables from fridge to reduce food waste.
